summaryText: What an incredible sermon about the transformative power of being 'washed' by God's grace! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered a powerful message diving deep into the biblical understanding of sin, repentance, and baptism. Have you ever felt like your past mistakes are too big for God to forgive? This sermon is for you! PT breaks down the Hebrew words for sin - showing us that sin is essentially 'missing the mark' of God's perfection. But here's the beautiful part: God doesn't just leave us in our mess. Through Jesus' sacrifice, we can be completely washed clean! The sermon takes us through the profound meaning of baptism - not just a religious ritual, but a public declaration of dying to our old self and being raised into a new life in Christ. Pastor Travis reminds us that baptism is about going public with our faith, joining God's family, and celebrating the incredible transformation God does in our lives. The most powerful moment? Understanding that Jesus' blood washes us completely clean - no matter what we've done. This isn't just a message about religious practice; it's about radical redemption and a fresh start with God!
mainPoints: Understanding the different types of sin: missing the mark, distorting what was good, and betraying relationships
Baptism is a symbol of dying to our old self and being raised in new life
Being 'washed' by God means complete transformation and forgiveness

versesMentioned.text: Have mercy on me, O God, according to your unfailing love; according to your great compassion blot out my transgressions. Wash away all my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin.
For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God.
Peter replied, 'Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.'
Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you.
For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

Monday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'
Monday.focus: Embracing your new identity in Christ
Monday.action: Write down three things from your 'old self' that you want to leave behind. Spend time in prayer surrendering these to God.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me fully embrace the new life You've given me. Show me the areas where I'm still holding onto my old self, and give me the strength to let go and walk in Your newness.

Tuesday.scripture: Romans 6:4: 'We were therefore buried with him through baptism into death in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, we too may live a new life.'
Tuesday.action: Research the biblical meaning of baptism. If you haven't been baptized, consider speaking with a church leader about taking this step.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me understand the deeper meaning of baptism. Show me what it means to truly die to my old self and live a new life in You.

Wednesday.scripture: Ephesians 1:7: 'In him we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, in accordance with the riches of God's grace.'
Wednesday.action: Make a list of past mistakes or sins you struggle to forgive yourself for. Symbolically 'release' these to God, acknowledging His complete forgiveness.
Wednesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, thank You for Your limitless grace. Help me truly accept Your forgiveness and stop carrying the weight of past mistakes.

Thursday.scripture: 1 John 1:9: 'If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just and will forgive us our sins and purify us from all unrighteousness.'
Thursday.focus: The power of confession and repentance
Thursday.action: Spend time in honest reflection. Confess any areas where you've been holding back from fully surrendering to God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, reveal any hidden areas of my heart that need Your cleansing. Give me the courage to be completely honest with You and receive Your healing.

Friday.scripture: Colossians 2:12: 'Having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through your faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.'
Friday.action: Identify one area of your life where you can demonstrate your new identity in Christ. Look for an opportunity to show God's love practically.
Friday.prayer: God, show me how to live out my new life in Christ today. Give me opportunities to reflect Your love and grace to others.

Saturday.scripture: Galatians 3:27: 'For all of you who were baptized into Christ have clothed yourselves with Christ.'
Saturday.action: Reflect on how your identity has changed since accepting Christ. Journal about the transformation you've experienced.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, help me fully embrace my identity in You. Continue to transform me and make me more like Jesus each day.
